newsitem.title: ROMANIA: BUCHAREST BOURSE PUTS ON STRONGER SHOW.
newsitem.headline: BUCHAREST BOURSE PUTS ON STRONGER SHOW.

text.p: The Bucharest stock exchange
recovered its poised on Thursday, as investors looked with
renewed interest at lower-priced stocks. Most average prices,
volume and turnover drifted higher.
"After the price falls of the last sessions, investors
ended their waiting game and started buying," a trader said.
Gainers in average prices led decliners 15 to 11, with one
stock remaining unchanged. Some stocks also closed higher,
helped by deals made in late trading, brokers said.
Two unofficial indices, the VAB and the BIG, jumped by 2.7
and respectively 2.78 percent from the previous session. BIG
first-tier index was 3.13 percent at 2,666.88 points.
Active buying pulled volume some 574,000 shares higher to
2.3 million and helped turnover rise by around two billion lei
to 6.7 billion.
Traders said they expected the market to extend its
recovery on Friday.
The first tier continued to attract strong interest, taking
82 percent of turnover and trading around two million shares.
Two high-caps gained on both average and closing quotes,
while the other two first-tier listings lost ground.
Antibiotice pharmaceuticals company put on 200
lei to close at 4,300 and fertiliser maker Azomures
ended 400 lei stronger at 2,500.
Chemical plant Oltchim and Terapia
pharmaceuticals shed 150 lei each to end at 2,250 and
respectively 5,350.
On the second tier, Policolor dye maker stayed in
demand. It traded more than 187,000 shares on turnover of 912.8
million lei, including a special deal. But it closed 600 lei
weaker at 4,500 in heavy supply. The special deal involved
53,823 shares worth a total 242.2 million lei.
Trading on the second tier was otherwise thin, with nine
stocks having no deal and two suspended.
MAY 28 MAY 27 Week's change 1997 high 1997 low
-- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
